title: Tess Daly: 'I'm bloody proud to be 50. I appreciate every single thing I've got'
text:
It’s the birthday that once meant the death knell for the careers of women on television. But Tess Daly is in her prime – and on a high. Louise Gannon meets her

There’s always been grit behind the glamour of Tess Daly. Over the past 15 years, wearing a sparkly evening dress, high heels and a big smile, she has redefined the role of the prime-time TV presenter. At 50, she remains firmly at the helm of the BBC’s flagship entertainment show, Strictly Come Dancing. Even after the loss of co-host Bruce Forsyth, its viewing figures have continued to soar, against all expectations, trouncing those of its ITV competitors The X Factor and Britain’s Got Talent.

Like many Stella readers, rather than...
description: It’s the birthday that once meant the death knell for the careers of women on television.
